statements.name: PROC CAUSALTRT
statements.description: estimates the average causal effect of a binary treatment on a continuous or discrete outcome
statements.help:
PROC CAUSALTRT <options>;                 
	BOOTSTRAP < options>;                 
	BY  variables;                 
	CLASS  variable <(options)>...<variable <(options)>></ global-options>;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	MODEL  outcome <(variable-options)><= effects></ model-options>;                 
	OUTPUT <OUT=SAS-data-set><keyword=name...keyword=name>;                 
	PSMODEL  treatment <(variable-options)><= effects </ psmodel-options>>;

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies a number to be used as the α level for confidence limits in the "Analysis of Causal Effect" table

arguments.name: ATT
arguments.description: estimates the average treatment effect for the treated. When this option is applied, it replaces the default estimation of the average treatment effect.

arguments.name: COVDIFFPS
arguments.description: computes weighted and unweighted standardized mean differences (between treatment and control conditions) and variance ratios (treatment to control) for the covariates (effects) in the propensity score model

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the SAS data set that contains the data to be analyzed

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: sorts the levels of the outcome variable for a binary model in reverse of the specified order

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: specifies the method to use to estimate the potential outcomes and treatment effect
arguments.help: METHOD= AIPW | IPW | IPWR | IPWS | REGADJ | IPWREG

arguments.name: AIPW
arguments.description: performs a doubly robust estimation by using augmented inverse probability weighting

arguments.name: IPW
arguments.description: uses a basic inverse probability weighting method

arguments.name: IPWR
arguments.description: uses an inverse probability weighting method with ratio adjustment

arguments.name: IPWS
arguments.description: uses an inverse probability weighting method with ratio and scale adjustments

arguments.name: IPWREG
arguments.description: performs a doubly robust estimation by using inverse probability weighted regression adjustment

arguments.name: REGADJ
arguments.description: uses regression adjustment

arguments.name: NAMELEN=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum length of effect names in tables and output data sets to be n characters, where n is a value between 20 and 128

arguments.name: NLOPTIONS
arguments.description: specifies options for the nonlinear optimization methods that are used for fitting the specified models

arguments.name: ABSCONV=
arguments.description: specifies an absolute function convergence criterion

arguments.name: ABSFCONV=
arguments.description: specifies an absolute function difference convergence criterion [label=proc_nloptions_absgconv]{ABSGCONV=r} specifies an absolute gradient convergence criterion

arguments.name: FCONV=
arguments.description: specifies a relative function convergence criterion

arguments.name: GCONV=
arguments.description: specifies a relative gradient convergence criterion

arguments.name: MAXFUNC=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of function calls in the optimization process

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of iterations in the optimization process

arguments.name: MAXTIME=
arguments.description: specifies an upper limit of r seconds of CPU time for the optimization process

arguments.name: TECHNIQUE=
arguments.description: specifies the optimization technique to obtain maximum likelihood estimates
arguments.help: TECHNIQUE=CONGRA | DBLDOG | NEWRAP | NRRIDG | QUANEW | TRUREG

arguments.name: CONGRA
arguments.description: performs a conjugate-gradient optimization

arguments.name: DBLDOG
arguments.description: performs a version of double-dogleg optimization

arguments.name: NEWRAP
arguments.description: performs a Newton-Raphson optimization that combines a line-search algorithm with ridging

arguments.name: NRRIDG
arguments.description: performs a Newton-Raphson optimization with ridging

arguments.name: QUANEW
arguments.description: performs a dual quasi-Newton optimization

arguments.name: TRUREG
arguments.description: performs a trust-region optimization

arguments.name: NOEFFECT
arguments.description: suppresses the display of all output that involves the outcome variable

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: suppresses all displayed output

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of the classification variables (which are specified in the CLASS statement)

arguments.name: PALL
arguments.description: displays all optional output

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: controls plots that are produced through ODS Graphics

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: produces all plots that are available for the specified estimation method

arguments.name: LOGITPSCORE
arguments.description: produces overlaid density plots for the logit of the propensity score

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all plots

arguments.name: OUTBYPSCORE
arguments.description: produces a scatter plot of the outcome variable by the propensity score for nonbinary outcomes

arguments.name: OUTBYWEIGHT
arguments.description: produces a scatter plot of the outcome variable by weight for nonbinary outcomes

arguments.name: PSCLOUD
arguments.description: produces a point cloud of the propensity scores by jittering within the control and treatment conditions

arguments.name: PSCOVDEN
arguments.description: produces density plots for the covariates or continuous effects that are specified in the PSMODEL statement [label=proc_plots_psdist]{PSDIST} produces a box plot of the propensity score for each treatment condition

arguments.name: WEIGHTCLOUD
arguments.description: produces a point cloud of the weights by jittering within the control and treatment conditions

arguments.name: WEIGHTDIST
arguments.description: produces a box plot of the weights for each treatment condition

arguments.name: POUTCOMEMOD
arguments.description: displays parameter estimates for the outcome models for the control and treatment conditions

arguments.name: PPSMODEL
arguments.description: displays parameter estimates for the propensity score model

arguments.name: RORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of the outcome variable

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: specifies the tolerance for testing the singularity of a matrix, where tolerance must be between 0 and 1

arguments.name: THREADS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of threads for analytic computations and overrides the SAS system option THREADS | NOTHREADS

statements.name: BOOTSTRAP
statements.description: requests bootstrap estimation of confidence intervals for the potential outcome means and treatment effect estimates

arguments.name: BOOTCI
arguments.description: computes bootstrap-based confidence intervals for the potential outcome means and the treatment effect estimates, and displays the values in the "Analysis of Causal Effect" table

arguments.name: BC
arguments.description: produces bias-corrected confidence intervals

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: produces confidence intervals that are based on the assumption that bootstrap estimates follow a normal distribution

arguments.name: PERC
arguments.description: produces percentile-based confidence intervals

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: produces all three confidence intervals

arguments.name: BOOTDATA=
arguments.description: specifies the SAS-data-set that contains the estimates for the potential outcome means and treatment effect for each bootstrap sample that converges

arguments.name: NBOOT=
arguments.description: specifies the number of bootstrap sample data sets

arguments.name: NOSKIP
arguments.description: includes in the bootstrap estimation bootstrap samples that have inconsistent class levels in either the treatment or outcome model

statements.name: BY
statements.description: produces separate analyses of observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: names the classification variables to be used as explanatory variables in the analysis

arguments.name: CPREFIX=
arguments.description: uses at most the first n characters of a CLASS variable name in creating names for the corresponding design variables

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the sort order of the classification variable

arguments.name: LPREFIX=
arguments.description: uses at most the first n characters of a CLASS variable label in creating labels for the corresponding design variables

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: treats missing values (blanks for character variables and ., ._, .A,..., .Z for numeric variables) as valid values for the CLASS variable

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of classification variables

arguments.name: REF=
arguments.description: specifies a level of the classification variable to be put at the end of the list of levels. You can specify the level of the variable to use as the reference level, or you can use the FIRST or LAST keyword to designate the first or last ordered level as reference.

arguments.name: TRUNCATE
arguments.description: specifies the length (n) of variable values to use in determining the CLASS variable levels

arguments.name: CPREFIX=
arguments.description: uses at most the first n characters of a CLASS variable name in creating names for the corresponding design variables

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the sort order of the classification variable

arguments.name: LPREFIX=
arguments.description: uses at most the first n characters of a CLASS variable label in creating labels for the corresponding design variables

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: treats missing values (blanks for character variables and ., ._, .A,..., .Z for numeric variables) as valid values for the CLASS variable

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of classification variables

arguments.name: REF=
arguments.description: specifies a level of the classification variable to be put at the end of the list of levels. You can specify the level of the variable to use as the reference level, or you can use the FIRST or LAST keyword to designate the first or last ordered level as reference.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a variable in the input data set that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: MODEL
statements.description: identifies the outcome variable and the model for the outcome that may be used by the estimation method

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies a number to use as the α level for confidence limits that the MODEL statement computes [label=model_dist]{DIST=keyword} specifies the built-in probability distribution to use in the model

arguments.name: BIN
arguments.description: specifies a binary distribution

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: specifies a gamma distribution

arguments.name: IGAUSSIAN
arguments.description: specifies an inverse Gaussian distribution

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: specifies a normal distribution

arguments.name: POISSON
arguments.description: specifies a Poisson distribution

arguments.name: LINK=
arguments.description: specifies the link function in the model

arguments.name: CLOGLOG
arguments.description: specifies a complementary log-log link function

arguments.name: IDENTITY
arguments.description: specifies an identity link function

arguments.name: INVERSE
arguments.description: specifies a reciprocal link function

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: specifies a log link function

arguments.name: LOGIT
arguments.description: specifies a logit link function

arguments.name: POWERMINUS2
arguments.description: specifies a power with exponent -2 link function

arguments.name: PROBIT
arguments.description: specifies a probit link function

arguments.name: NOSCALE
arguments.description: holds the scale parameter fixed

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: specifies the value used for the scale parameter when the NOSCALE option is specified

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the order of the outcome categories

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: specifies the event category for the binary outcome model

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels of the outcome variable

arguments.name: REFERENCE=
arguments.description: specifies the reference category for the binary outcome model

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: creates a new SAS data set that contains all the variables in the input data set and optionally contains predicted values that are used to estimate the treatment effect

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: names the output data set

arguments.name: IPW=
arguments.description: requests the predicted inverse probability weight

arguments.name: POCNT=
arguments.description: requests the predicted potential outcome for the control condition

arguments.name: POTRT=
arguments.description: requests the predicted potential outcome for the treatment condition

arguments.name: PSCORE=
arguments.description: <sas{PS=name} requests the predicted propensity score>

statements.name: PSMODEL
statements.description: identifies the treatment variable and the model for the treatment that may be used by the estimation method

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies a number to use as the α level for confidence limits that the PSMODEL statement computes

arguments.name: PLOTS
arguments.description: produces ODS graphics by using the predicted propensity scores

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: produces all possible plots

arguments.name: LOGITPSCORE
arguments.description: produces overlaid density plots for the logit of the propensity score within each treatment condition

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: suppresses all plots that the SMODEL statement could produce

arguments.name: OUTBYPSCORE
arguments.description: produces a scatter plot of the outcome variable by the propensity score for nonbinary outcomes

arguments.name: OUTBYWEIGHT
arguments.description: produces a scatter plot of the outcome variable by weight for nonbinary outcomes

arguments.name: PSCLOUD
arguments.description: produces a point cloud of the propensity scores by jittering within the control and treatment conditions

arguments.name: PSCOVDEN
arguments.description: produces density plots for the covariates or continuous effects that are specified in the PSMODEL statement

arguments.name: EFFECTS
arguments.description: specifies the effects for which density plots are produced

arguments.name: UNPACK
arguments.description: suppresses paneling

arguments.name: UNPACKEFFECTS
arguments.description: creates a separate panel for each effect

arguments.name: PSDIST
arguments.description: produces a box plot of the propensity scores for each treatment condition

arguments.name: WEIGHTCLOUD
arguments.description: produces a point cloud of the weights by jittering within the control and treatment conditions

arguments.name: WEIGHTDIST
arguments.description: produces a box plot of the weights for each treatment condition

arguments.name: ONLY
arguments.description: suppresses plots that are not specified as a plot-request

arguments.name: UNPACK
arguments.description: suppresses paneling

arguments.name: WGTFLAG=
arguments.description: specifies a number to use to flag large weights

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the order of the treatment categories

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: specifies the event category for the binary treatment model

arguments.name: REFERENCE=
arguments.description: specifies the reference category for the binary treatment model
